titlestmt.titleproper: Smith College Office of Inclusion, Diversity and Equity recordsCA.MS.01034

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-02-25 11:22:23 -0500.

did.unittitle: Smith College Office of Inclusion, Diversity and Equity records

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Archives has not processed, rearrarranged, or weeded the materials in any way since their transfer.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
The Office of Inclusion, Diversity and Equity records, Smith College Archives, CA.MS.01034, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts .

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection's 2 archive half-letter boxes are arranged in 2 accessions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to researchers according to the regulations of the College Archives.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. All rights to this material are owned by the Smith College Archives. Permission to publish material from the collection must be requested from the College Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material in the Office of Inclusion, Diversity and Equity records includes memory booklets, orientation program booklets, training program material, and a report titled "Affirmative Action" by Shelton Burden. The material spans the years 1992 to present.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Smith College Office of Institutional Diversity

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1970 as a way to support the recruitment and retention of African American students at Smith, the Bridge program has expanded over the years to welcome all students of color who are interested in establishing cross-cultural friendships, while also becoming part of the larger Smith community.

Through interactive seminars and group activities led by faculty and student leaders, incoming students share their perspectives with peers to better understand and appreciate similarities and differences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Memory booklets and orientation program booklets 2017
